category.title: ADS-B Target Reports
category.preamble: Surveillance data exchange. ADS-B Target Reports.

item.title: Aircraft Operational Status

content.value: TCAS II or ACAS RA not active
No capability for Trajectory Change Reports
No capability to support Target State Reports
Capable of supporting target State Reports

item.name: CDTIA
item.title: Cockpit Display of Traffic Information Airborne

item.definition: Identification of the operational services available in the aircraft while airborne.
item.remark: Note: - Additional Aircraft Status Information is available in the Reserved Expansion Field of Category 021.

item.title: Data Source Identification
item.definition: Identification of the ADS-B station providing information.
item.remark: Note: - The up-to-date list of SACs is published on the EUROCONTROL ASTERIX Web Site (http://www.eurocontrol.int/services/system-area-code-list).

item.title: Service Identification
item.definition: Identification of the service provided to one or more users.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. The service identification is allocated by the system. 2. The service identification is also available in item I023/015 [Ref. 3].

item.title: Service Management
item.definition: Identification of services offered by a ground station (identified by a SIC code).
item.remark:
Notes:
1. This item contains the same information as item I023/101 in ASTERIX category 023 [Ref. 3]. Since not all service users receive category 023 data, this information has to be conveyed in category 021 as well. 2. If this item is due to be sent according to the encoding rule above, it shall be sent with the next target report

item.title: Emitter Category

content.value: Highly manoeuvrable (5g acceleration capability) and high speed (>400 knots cruise)

item.definition: Characteristics of the originating ADS-B unit.

item.title: Target Report Descriptor

content.value: Range Check passed, CPR Validation pending
Equipment capable to provide Selected Altitude
Equipment not capable to provide Selected Altitude

item.definition: Type and characteristics of the data as transmitted by a system.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. Bit 3 indicates that the position reported by the target is within a credible range from the ground station. The range check is followed by the CPR validation to ensure that global and local position decoding both indicate valid position information. Bit 3=1 indicates that the range check was done, but the CPR validation is not yet completed. Once CPR validation is completed, Bit 3 will be reset to 0. 2. The second extension signals the reasons for which the report has been indicated as suspect (indication Confidence Level (CL) in the first extension). 3. Bit 2 indicates that the Range Check failed, i.e. the target is reported outside the credible range for the Ground Station. For operational users such a target will be suppressed. In services used for monitoring the Ground Station, the target will be transmitted with bit 2 indicating the fault condition. 4. Bit 6, if set to 1, indicates that the position reported by the target was validated by an independent means and a discrepancy was detected. If no independent position check is implemented, the default value “0” is to be used. 5. Bit 5 represents the setting of the GO/NOGO-bit as defined in item I023/100 of category 023 [Ref. 3]. 6. Bit 7, if set to 1, indicates that a lookup in a Black-list/White-list failed, indicating that the target may be suspect

item.title: Mode 3/A Code in Octal Representation
item.definition: Mode-3/A code converted into octal representation.

item.title: Time of Applicability for Position
item.definition: Time of applicability of the reported position, in the form of elapsed time since last midnight, expressed as UTC.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. The time of applicability value is reset to zero at every midnight. 2. The time of applicability indicates the exact time at which the position transmitted in the target report is valid.

item.title: Time of Applicability for Velocity
item.definition: Time of applicability (measurement) of the reported velocity, in the form of elapsed time since last midnight, expressed as UTC.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. The time of the applicability value is reset to zero at every midnight. 2. The time of applicability indicates the exact time at which the velocity information transmitted in the target report is valid. 3. This item will not be available in some ADS-B technologies.

item.title: Time of Message Reception for Position
item.definition: Time of reception of the latest position squitter in the Ground Station, in the form of elapsed time since last midnight, expressed as UTC.
item.remark: Note: - The time of message reception value is reset to zero at every midnight.

item.title: Time of Message Reception of Position-High Precision

item.name: TOMRP
item.title: Fractional Part of the Time of Message Reception for Position in the Ground Station

item.definition: Time at which the latest ADS-B position information was received by the ground station, expressed as fraction of the second of the UTC Time.

item.title: Time of Message Reception for Velocity
item.definition: Time of reception of the latest velocity squitter in the Ground Station, in the form of elapsed time since last midnight, expressed as UTC.
item.remark: Note: - The time of message reception value is reset to zero at every midnight.

item.title: Time of Message Reception of Velocity-High Precision

item.name: TOMRP
item.title: Fractional Part of the Time of Message Reception for Position in the Ground Station

item.definition: Time at which the latest ADS-B velocity information was received by the ground station, expressed as fraction of the second of the UTC Time.

item.title: Time of ASTERIX Report Transmission
item.definition: Time of the transmission of the ASTERIX category 021 report in the form of elapsed time since last midnight, expressed as UTC.
item.remark: Note: - The time of ASTERIX report transmission value is reset to zero at every midnight.

item.title: Target Address
item.definition: Target address (emitter identifier) assigned uniquely to each target.

item.title: Quality Indicators

item.name: NUCRNACV
item.title: Navigation Uncertainty Category for Velocity NUCr or the Navigation Accuracy Category for Velocity NACv

item.name: NUCPNIC
item.title: Navigation Uncertainty Category for Position NUCp or Navigation Integrity Category NIC
item.remark: Notes: 1. Apart from the “PIC” item, all items are defined as per the respective link technology protocol version (“MOPS version”, see I021/210). 2. The primary subfield is kept for backwards compatibility reasons. Version 2 NIC-values shall be mapped accordingly. This is required to ensure that downstream systems, which are not capable of interpreting extensions 2 and 3 (because they use an ASTERIX

item.name: NICBARO
item.title: Navigation Integrity Category for Barometric Altitude

item.name: SDA
item.title: Horizontal Position System Design Assurance Level (as Defined in Version 2)

item.definition: ADS-B quality indicators transmitted by a/c according to MOPS version.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. Apart from the “PIC” item, all items are defined as per the respective link technology protocol version (“MOPS version”, see I021/210). 2. The primary subfield is kept for backwards compatibility reasons. Version 2 NIC-values shall be mapped accordingly. This is required to ensure that downstream systems, which are not capable of interpreting extensions 2 and 3 (because they use an ASTERIX edition earlier than 2.0) still get the required information 3. “Version 1” or “Version 2” refers to the MOPS version as defined in data item I021/210, bits 6/4 4. “Version 2” refers to the MOPS version as defined in data item I021/210, bits 6/4 5. PIC=0 is defined for completeness only. In this case the third extension shall not be generated. 6. For ED102A/DO260B PIC values of 7 and 9, the NIC supplements for airborne messages (NIC supplements A/B) and surface messages (NIC supplements A/C) are listed. For ED102A/DO260B PIC=8, the NIC supplements A/B for airborne messages are listed. For DO260A PIC values of 7 and 8, the NIC supplement for airborne messages is shown in brackets. The aircraft air-ground status, and hence message type (airborne or surface), is derived from the GBS-bit in I021/040, 1 st extension.

item.title: Trajectory Intent

content.value: Trajectory Intent Data is available for this aircraft
Trajectory Intent Data is not available for this aircraft
Trajectory Intent Data is not valid

item.name: TCPN
item.description: Trajectory Change Point number

item.name: TRA
item.description: Turn Radius Availability

item.definition: Reports indicating the 4D intended trajectory of the aircraft.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. NC is set to one when the aircraft will not fly the path described by the TCP data. 2. TCP numbers start from zero. 3. LT = Lateral Type 4. VT = Vertical Type 5. TOV gives the estimated time before reaching the point. It is defined as the absolute time from midnight. 6. TOV is meaningful only if TOA is set to 1.

item.title: Position in WGS-84 Co-ordinates
item.definition: Position in WGS-84 Co-ordinates.
item.remark:
Notes:
- Positive longitude indicates East. Positive latitude indicates North.

item.title: High-Resolution Position in WGS-84 Co-ordinates
item.definition: Position in WGS-84 Co-ordinates in high resolution.
item.remark:
Notes:
- Positive longitude indicates East. Positive latitude indicates North.

item.title: Message Amplitude
item.definition: Amplitude, in dBm, of ADS-B messages received by the ground station, coded in two’s complement.
item.remark: Note: - The value gives the amplitude of the latest received squitter.

item.title: Geometric Height
item.definition: Minimum height from a plane tangent to the earth’s ellipsoid, defined by WGS-84, in two’s complement form.
item.remark: Note: 1. LSB is required to be less than 10 ft by ICAO. 2. A value of ‘0111111111111111’ indicates that the aircraft transmits a “greater than” indication.

item.title: Flight Level
item.definition: Flight Level from barometric measurements,not QNH corrected, in two’s complement form.

item.title: Selected Altitude
item.definition: The Selected Altitude as provided by the avionics and corresponding either to the MCP/FCU Selected Altitude (the ATC cleared altitude entered by the flight crew into the avionics) or to the FMS Selected Altitude.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. The Selected Altitude provided in this field is not necessarily the “Target Altitude” as defined by ICAO. 2. The value of “Source” (bits 15/14) indicating “unknown” or “Aircraft Altitude” is kept for backward compatibility as these indications are not provided by “version 2” systems as defined by data item I021/210, bits 6/4. 3. Vertical mode indications supporting the determination of the nature of the Selected Altitude are provided in the Reserved Expansion Field in the subfield NAV.

item.title: Final State Selected Altitude
item.definition: The vertical intent value that corresponds with the ATC cleared altitude, as derived from the Altitude Control Panel (MCP/FCU).
item.remark:
Notes:
- This item is kept for backward compatibility but shall not be used for “version 2” ADS-B systems (as defined by data item I021/210, bits 6/4) for which item 146 will be used to forward the MCP/FCU or the FMS selected altitude information. For “version 2” ADS-B systems, the vertical mode indications will be provided through the Reserved Expansion Field in the subfield NAV .

item.title: Air Speed
item.definition: Calculated Air Speed (Element of Air Vector).

item.title: True Airspeed
item.definition: True Air Speed.
item.remark:
Notes:
- The RE-Bit, if set, indicates that the value to be transmitted is beyond the range defined for this specific data item and the applied technology. In this case the True Air Speed contains the maximum value that can be downloaded from the aircraft avionics and the RE-bit indicates that the actual value is greater than the value contained in the field.

item.title: Magnetic Heading
item.definition: Magnetic Heading (Element of Air Vector).
item.remark:
Notes:
- True North Heading is defined in the Reserved Expansion Field in the subfield TNH.

item.title: Barometric Vertical Rate
item.definition: Barometric Vertical Rate, in two’s complement form.
item.remark:
Notes:
- The RE-Bit, if set, indicates that the value to be transmitted is beyond the range defined for this specific data item and the applied technology. In this case the Barometric Vertical Rate contains the maximum value that can be downloaded from the aircraft avionics and the RE-bit indicates that the actual value is greater than the value contained in the field.

item.title: Geometric Vertical Rate
item.definition: Geometric Vertical Rate, in two’s complement form, with reference to WGS-84.
item.remark:
Notes:
- The RE-Bit, if set, indicates that the value to be transmitted is beyond the range defined for this specific data item and the applied technology. In this case the Geometric Vertical Rate contains the maximum value that can be downloaded from the aircraft avionics and the RE-bit indicates that the actual value is greater than the value contained in the field.

item.title: Airborne Ground Vector

item.name: TA
item.title: Track Angle Clockwise Reference to True North

item.definition: Ground Speed and Track Angle elements of Airborne Ground Vector.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. The RE-Bit, if set, indicates that the value to be transmitted is beyond the range defined for this specific data item and the applied technology. In this case the Ground Speed contains the maximum value that can be downloaded from the aircraft avionics and the RE-bit indicates that the actual value is greater than the value contained in the field. 2. The Surface Ground Vector format is defined in the Reserved Expansion Field in the subfield SGV.

item.title: Track Number
item.definition: An integer value representing a unique reference to a track record within a particular track file.

item.title: Track Angle Rate
item.definition: Rate of Turn, in two’s complement form.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. A positive value represents a right turn, whereas a negative value represents a left turn. 2. Maximum value means Maximum value or above. 3. This item will not be transmitted for the technology 1090 MHz Extended Squitter.

item.title: Target Identification
item.definition: Target (aircraft or vehicle) identification in 8 characters, as reported by the target.

item.title: Target Status

content.value: Temporary Alert (change in Mode 3/A Code other than emergency)

item.definition: Status of the target
item.remark:
Notes:
- Bit-8 (ICF), when set to “1” indicates that new information is available in the Mode S GICB registers 40, 41 or 42.

item.title: MOPS Version

content.value: The MOPS Version is supported by the GS
The MOPS Version is not supported by the GS

item.definition: Identification of the MOPS version used by a/c to supply ADS-B information.
item.remark:
Notes:
- VN sub-field shall contain a value describing the MOPS used by each aircraft. The versions of other link technologies are assumed to be in line with the 1090 ES MOPS versions and the corresponding MASPS versions.
- Bit 7 (VNS) when set to 1 indicates that the aircraft transmits a MOPS Version indication that is not supported by the Ground Station. However, since MOPS versions are supposed to be backwards compatible, the GS has attempted to interpret the message and achieved a credible result. The fact that the MOPS version received is not supported by the GS is submitted as additional information to subsequent processing systems.

item.title: Met Information
item.definition: Meteorological information.

item.title: Roll Angle
item.definition: The roll angle, in two’s complement form, of an aircraft executing a turn.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. Negative Value indicates “Left Wing Down”. 2. Resolution provided by the technology “1090 MHz Extended Squitter” is 1 degree.

item.title: Mode S MB Data
item.definition: Mode S Comm B data as extracted from the aircraft transponder.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. For the transmission of BDS20, item 170 should be used. 2. For the transmission of BDS30, item 260 is used.

item.title: ACAS Resolution Advisory Report
item.definition: Currently active Resolution Advisory (RA), if any, generated by the ACAS associated with the transponder transmitting the RA message and threat identity data.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. Version denotes the MOPS version as defined in I021/210, bits 6/4 2. This data items copies the value of BDS register 6,1 for message type 28, subtype 2 3. The “TYP” and “STYP” items are implementation (i.e. link technology) dependent. 4. Refer to ICAO Annex 10 SARPs for detailed explanations [Ref. 10]

item.title: Surface Capabilities and Characteristics

content.value: Position transmitted is not ADS-B position reference point
Position transmitted is the ADS-B position reference point

item.name: CDTIS
item.title: Cockpit Display of Traffic Information Surface

item.name: B2LOW
item.title: Class B2 Transmit Power Less Than 70 Watts

item.name: LW
item.title: Length and Width of the Aircraft

item.definition: Operational capabilities of the aircraft while on the ground.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. Version 2 (as defined in I021/210, bits 6/4) data technology protocols encode “No Data or Unknown” with value 0. In this case data item I021/271, first extension is not generated. 2. As of edition 2.2 the structure of this data item has been changed. Edition 2.2 is not backwards compatible with previous editions.

item.title: Data Ages

item.name: AOS
item.title: Aircraft Operational Status Age
item.description: Age of the information transmitted in item I021/008.

item.name: TRD
item.title: Target Report Descriptor Age
item.description: Age of the Target Report Descriptor, item I021/040

item.name: M3A
item.title: Mode 3/A Age
item.description: Age of the Mode 3/A Code, item I021/070

item.name: QI
item.title: Quality Indicators Age
item.description: Age of the Quality Indicators, item I021/090

item.name: TI1
item.title: Trajectory Intent Age
item.description: Age of the Trajectory Intent information, item I021/110

item.name: MAM
item.title: Message Amplitude Age
item.description: Age of the message amplitude, item I021/132

item.name: GH
item.title: Geometric Height Age
item.description: Age of the Geometric Height, item 021/140

item.name: FL
item.title: Flight Level Age
item.description: Age of the Flight Level, item I021/145

item.name: ISA
item.title: Intermediate State Selected Altitude Age
item.description: Age of the Intermediate State Selected Altitude, item I021/146

item.name: FSA
item.title: Final State Selected Altitude Age
item.description: Age of the Final State Selected Altitude, item I021/148

item.name: AS
item.title: Air Speed Age
item.description: Age of the Air Speed, item I021/150

item.name: TAS
item.title: True Air Speed Age
item.description: Age of the True Air Speed, item I021/151

item.name: MH
item.title: Magnetic Heading Age
item.description: Age of the Magnetic Heading, item I021/152

item.name: BVR
item.title: Barometric Vertical Rate Age
item.description: Age of the Barometric Vertical Rate, item I021/155

item.name: GVR
item.title: Geometric Vertical Rate Age
item.description: Age of the Geometric Vertical Rate, item I021/157

item.name: GV
item.title: Ground Vector Age
item.description: Age of the Ground Vector, item I021/160

item.name: TAR
item.title: Track Angle Rate Age
item.description: Age of the Track Angle Rate, item I021/165

item.name: TI2
item.title: Target Identification Age
item.description: Age of the Target Identification, item I021/170

item.name: TS
item.title: Target Status Age
item.description: Age of the Target Status, item I021/200

item.name: MET
item.title: Met Information Age
item.description: Age of the Meteorological Information, item I021/220

item.name: ROA
item.title: Roll Angle Age
item.description: Age of the Roll Angle, item I021/230

item.name: ARA
item.title: ACAS Resolution Advisory Age
item.description: Age of the latest update of an active ACAS Resolution Advisory, item I021/260

item.name: SCC
item.title: Surface Capabilities and Characteristics Age
item.description: Age of the information on the surface capabilities and characteristics of the respective target, item I021/271

item.definition: Ages of the data provided.
item.remark:
Notes:
- In all the subfields, the maximum value indicates “maximum value or above”.

item.title: Receiver ID
item.definition: Designator of Ground Station in Distributed System.

item.name: RE
item.title: Reserved Expansion Field
item.definition: Expansion

item.name: SP
item.title: Special Purpose Field
item.definition: Special Purpose Field
